option.name: Miscellaneous C source specific flags
option.tip: Flags, listed here, would be used only when compiling source files of content-type 'C Source File'. To more precisely control flag applicability, use the syntax '[ext1, ext2: -opt1 -opt2 -opt3]'. E.g. '[c: -xc]'.

option.name: Miscellaneous C++ source specific flags
option.tip: Flags, listed here, would be used only when compiling source files of content-type 'C++ Source File'. To more precisely control flag applicability, use the syntax '[ext1, ext2: -opt1 -opt2 -opt3]'. E.g. '[cpp: -xc++]'.

option.name: Miscellaneous assembly source specific flags
option.tip: Flags, listed here, would be used only when compiling source files of content-type 'Assembly Source File'. To more precisely control flag applicability, use the syntax '[ext1, ext2: -opt1 -opt2 -opt3]'. E.g. '[asm: -xti-asm]'.

option.name: Select ARM architecture variant (-march)
option.tip: Aliases: -march<BODY>Select ARM architecture variant

option.name: Select ARM processor variant (-mcpu)
option.tip: Aliases: -mcpu<BODY>Select ARM processor variant

option.name: Select assumed floating-point ABI (-mfloat-abi)
option.tip:
Aliases: -mfloat-abi<BODY>Select assumed floating-point ABI:
hard - utilize available floating-point hardware and FPU calling conventions; soft - use calls to runtime library functions for floating-point operations

option.name: Select floating-point hardware processor (-mfpu)
option.tip: Aliases: -mfpu<BODY>Select floating-point hardware processor

option.name: Endian-ness (big/little) [See 'General' page to edit]
option.tip: Endian-ness (big/little) [See 'General' page to edit]<BODY><ITEM>(-mbig-endian) - Select big-endian byte order<ITEM>(-mlittle-endian) - Select little-endian byte order

option.name: Select processor mode (arm/thumb)
option.tip: Select processor mode (arm/thumb)<BODY><ITEM>(-mthumb) - Compile for thumb mode<ITEM>(-marm) - Compile for arm mode

option.name: Select optimization paradigm/level (-O)
option.tip:
Aliases: -O<BODY>Select compiler optimization level based on desired size/performance tradeoff:
-O0 disables optimizations; -O1 enables a restricted set of optimizations, allowing for a better debug experience; -O2 enables all optimizations from -O1 plus inter-procedural and other optimizations with an eye towards preserving a reasonable compile-time; -O3 enables all optimizations at -O2 plus optimizations that take longer to perform, trading an increase in compile time for potential performance improvements; -Ofast enables all optimizations from -O3 plus aggressive optimizations that may realize performance gains, but may also violate strict compliance with language standards
-Oz enables all optimizations from -O2 plus additional optimizations to reduce code size with the risk of sacrificing performance; -Os enables all optimizations from -O2 plus additional optimizations intended to reduce code size while mitigating negative effects on performance
-Og enables most optimizations from -O1, but may disable some to improvei debug experience

option.name: Enable relaxed assumptions about floating-point math (-ffast-math)
option.tip: Aliases: -ffast-math<BODY>Allow the compiler to make aggressive assumptions about floating-point math that may compromise strict accuracy for performance gains, including: 1) Floating-point math conforms to regular algebraic rules for real numbers (sddition and multiplication operators are associative) 2) Operands to floating-point operations cannot be NaN or Inf, and 3) Positive and negative zero are interchangeable

option.name: Add dir to #include search path (-I)
option.tip: Aliases: -I<BODY>Add the specified directory to the #include file search path list.

option.name: Pre-define NAME (-D)
option.tip: Aliases: -D<BODY>Pre-define a symbol with the id 'NAME', optionally setting it's contents to 'value'.

option.name: Undefine NAME (-U)
option.tip: Aliases: -U<BODY>Undefine the symbol with the id 'NAME'.

option.name: Identify output file name (-o)
option.tip: Aliases: -o<BODY>Identify output file name

option.name: Keep all temporary files generated during compilation (-save-temps)
option.tip: Aliases: -save-temps<BODY>Keep all temporary files generated during compilation

option.name: Assume strict compliance to selected DWARF standard (-gstrict-dwarf)
option.tip: Aliases: -gstrict-dwarf<BODY>Assume strict compliance to selected DWARF standard

option.name: Generate DWARF debug
option.tip: Generate DWARF debug<BODY><ITEM>(-gdwarf-3) - Emit DWARF v3 debug information<ITEM>(-gdwarf-2) - Emit DWARF v2 debug information<ITEM>(-gdwarf-4) - Emit DWARF v4 debug information<ITEM>(-g) - Emit DWARF debug information

option.name: Select assumed source file type (--language)
option.tip: Aliases: --language<BODY>Select assumed source file type

option.name: Emit warnings for conflicts with language standard (-pedantic)
option.tip: Aliases: -pedantic<BODY>Emit warnings for conflicts with language standard

option.name: Emit errors for conflicts with language standard (-pedantic-errors)
option.tip: Aliases: -pedantic-errors<BODY>Emit errors for conflicts with language standard

option.name: Select assumed C language standard (-std)
option.tip: Aliases: -std<BODY>Select assumed C language standard

option.name: Select assumed C++ language standard (-std)
option.tip: Aliases: -std<BODY>Select assumed C++ language standard

option.name: Select assumed source file type (-x)
Mode
option.tip: In 'automatic' mode, CCS will implicitly use the parser-preprocessing options to generate source dependency-graph. In 'manual' mode, no dependency-graph is generated, and the user has full manual control over the preprocessing options.

option.name: Pre-process source file, keep comments (-C)
option.tip: Aliases: -C<BODY>Pre-process source file, keep comments

option.name: Preprocess only (output to stdout) (-E)
option.tip: Aliases: -E<BODY>Preprocess only; do not compile, assemble, or link

option.name: Pre-process source file, emit dependency rules (-M)
option.tip: Aliases: -M<BODY>Pre-process source file, emit dependency rules

option.name: Pre-process source file, emit header file dependencies (-MM)
option.tip: Aliases: -MM<BODY>Pre-process source file, emit header file dependencies

option.name: Pre-process source file, emit list of macros defined (-dM)
option.tip: Aliases: -dM<BODY>Pre-process source file, emit list of macros defined

option.name: Emit compiler version information (--version)
option.tip: Aliases: --version<BODY>Emit compiler version information

option.name: Enable specified category of warning diagnostics (-W)
option.tip:
Aliases: -W<BODY>Enable warning diagnostice for each of the specified categories. Please consult available online clang documentation for information about available warning diagnostic categories.
(https://clang.llvm.org/docs/UsersManual.html)

option.name: Enable most warning messages (-Wall)
option.tip: Aliases: -Wall<BODY>Enable most warning messages

option.name: Interpret warnings in specified category as errors (-Werror)
option.tip: Aliases: -Werror<BODY>Interpret warnings in specified category as errors

option.name: Interpret all warnings as errors (-Werror)
option.tip: Aliases: -Werror<BODY>Interpret all warnings as errors

option.name: Disable specified category of warning diagnostics (-Wno-)
option.tip:
Aliases: -Wno-<BODY>Disable warning diagnostice for each of the specified categories. Please consult available online clang documentation for information about available warning diagnostic categories.
(https://clang.llvm.org/docs/UsersManual.html)

option.name: Override -Werror option for specified category (-Wno-error)
option.tip: Aliases: -Wno-error<BODY>Override -Werror option for specified category

option.name: Number of errors that, when reached, will abort compilation (-ferror-limit)
option.tip: Aliases: -ferror-limit<BODY>Number of errors that, when reached, will abort compilation

option.name: Check for syntax errors, then stop (-fsyntax-only)
option.tip: Aliases: -fsyntax-only<BODY>Check for syntax errors, then stop

option.name: Enable verbose output (-v)
option.tip: Aliases: -v<BODY>Enable verbose output

option.name: Suppress warnings (-w)
option.tip: Aliases: -w<BODY>Suppress warnings

option.name: Show diagnostic category with diagnostic messages
option.tip: Show diagnostic category with diagnostic messages<BODY><ITEM>(-fdiagnostics-show-option) - Display category information with diagnostic messages<ITEM>(fno-diagnostics-show-option) - Omit category information from diagnostic messages

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Display category information with diagnostic messages (-fdiagnostics-show-option)
Omit category information from diagnostic messages (fno-diagnostics-show-option)

option.name: Assume wchar_t types are 32-bits (-fno-short-wchar)
option.tip: Aliases: -fno-short-wchar<BODY>Assume wchar_t types are 32-bits

option.name: Enum type size
option.tip: Enum type size<BODY><ITEM>(-fshort-enums) - An enum_type of 'packed' means the compiler will assume the minimum number of bytes required to represent the full range of values specified in the enum<ITEM>(-fno-short-enums) - An enum_type of 'int' means the compiler will assume at least 4 bytes (32-bits) to represent the full range of values specified in the enum

option.name: Unaligned memory accesses
option.tip: Unaligned memory accesses<BODY><ITEM>(-munaligned-access) - Allow unaligned data accesses<ITEM>(-mno-unaligned-access) - Do not allow unaligned data accesses

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Do not allow unaligned data accesses (-mno-unaligned-access)

option.name: C++ exception handling
option.tip: C++ exception handling<BODY><ITEM>(-fno-exceptions) - Disable C++ exception handling<ITEM>(-fexceptions) - Enable C++ exception handling

option.name: C++ run-time type information
option.tip: C++ run-time type information<BODY><ITEM>(-fno-rtti) - Diable support for C++ run-time type information<ITEM>(-frtti) - Enable support for C++ run-time type information

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Diable support for C++ run-time type information (-fno-rtti)
Enable support for C++ run-time type information (-frtti)

option.name: Default char type signed-ness
option.tip: Default char type signed-ness<BODY><ITEM>(-funsigned-char) - Assume char type is unsigned by default<ITEM>(-fsigned-char) - Assume char type is signed by default

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Assume char type is unsigned by default (-funsigned-char)
Assume char type is signed by default (-fsigned-char)

option.name: Enable/Disable function outlining
option.tip: Enable/Disable function outlining<BODY><ITEM>(-moutline-inter-function) - Enable inter-function outlining<ITEM>(-moutline) - Enable outlining within functions<ITEM>(-mno-outline) - Disable function outlining

option.name: Common linkage for variables
option.tip: Common linkage for variables<BODY><ITEM>(-fcommon) - Variables without initializers will get common linkage<ITEM>(-fno-common) - Disable common linkage of uninitialized variables

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Variables without initializers will get common linkage (-fcommon)
Disable common linkage of uninitialized variables (-fno-common)

option.name: Define functions in their own sections
option.tip: Define functions in their own sections<BODY><ITEM>(-ffunction-sections) - Place each function in its own section<ITEM>(-fno-function-sections) - Do not place each function in its own section

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Place each function in its own section (-ffunction-sections)
Do not place each function in its own section (-fno-function-sections)

option.name: Define non-local variables in their own sections
option.tip: Define non-local variables in their own sections<BODY><ITEM>(-fdata-sections) - Place each data object in its own section<ITEM>(-fno-data-sections) - Do not place each data object in its own section

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Place each data object in its own section (-fdata-sections)
Do not place each data object in its own section (-fno-data-sections)

option.name: Identify pre-include source file (--include)
option.tip: Aliases: --include<BODY>Identify pre-include source file

option.name: Reserve the r9 register (-ffixed-r9)
option.tip: Aliases: -ffixed-r9<BODY>Reserve the r9 register

option.name: Use __cyg_profile_func_enter/exit() as entry/exit hooks (-finstrument-functions)
option.tip: Aliases: -finstrument-functions<BODY>Use __cyg_profile_func_enter/exit() as entry/exit hooks

option.name: No direct calls; All calls are made via register (-mlong-calls)
option.tip: Aliases: -mlong-calls<BODY>No direct calls; All calls are made via register

option.name: Disallow use of MOVT/MOVW pairs (-mno-movt)
option.tip: Aliases: -mno-movt<BODY>Disallow use of MOVT/MOVW pairs

option.name: Disallow negating/inverting negative immediates (-mno-neg-immediates)
option.tip: Aliases: -mno-neg-immediates<BODY>Disallow negating/inverting negative immediates

option.name: Function stack size metadata
option.tip: Function stack size metadata<BODY><ITEM>(-fno-stack-size-section) - Disable emission of function stack size metadata<ITEM>(-fstack-size-section) - Emit function stack size metadata to a section

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Disable emission of function stack size metadata (-fno-stack-size-section)
Emit function stack size metadata to a section (-fstack-size-section)

option.name: Disallow data accesses in code sections
option.tip: Disallow data accesses in code sections<BODY><ITEM>(-mexecute-only) - Disallow generation of data access to code sections<ITEM>(-mno-execute-only) - Allow generation of data access to code sections

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Disallow generation of data access to code sections (-mexecute-only)
Allow generation of data access to code sections (-mno-execute-only)

option.name: Report transformations performed by identified pass (-Rpass)
option.tip: Aliases: -Rpass<BODY>Report transformations performed by identified pass

option.name: Explain transformations performed by identified pass (-Rpass-analysis)
option.tip: Aliases: -Rpass-analysis<BODY>Explain transformations performed by identified pass

option.name: Report transformations missed by identified pass (-Rpass-missed)
option.tip: Aliases: -Rpass-missed<BODY>Report transformations missed by identified pass

option.name: YAML file written by -fsave-optimization-record (-foptimization-record-file)
option.tip: Aliases: -foptimization-record-file<BODY>YAML file written by -fsave-optimization-record

option.name: Write optimization remarks to YAML file (-fsave-optimization-record)
option.tip: Aliases: -fsave-optimization-record<BODY>Write optimization remarks to YAML file

option.name: Generate coverage mapping to enable code coverage analysis (-fcoverage-mapping)
option.tip: Aliases: -fcoverage-mapping<BODY>Generate coverage mapping to enable code coverage analysis

option.name: Generate instrumented code to collect coverage info (-fprofile-instr-generate)
option.tip: Aliases: -fprofile-instr-generate<BODY>Generate instrumented code to collect coverage info

option.name: Enable use of stack protectors
option.tip: Enable use of stack protectors<BODY><ITEM>(-fno-stack-protector) - Disable stack protectors<ITEM>(-fstack-protector) - Enable stack protectors for vulnerable functions<ITEM>(-fstack-protector-all) - Force use of stack protectors for all functions

enumeratedOptionValue.name: Enable stack protectors for vulnerable functions (-fstack-protector)
Force use of stack protectors for all functions (-fstack-protector-all)

option.name: Read options from specified file (@)
option.tip: Aliases: @<BODY>Read additional compile options from the specified file

option.name: Specify the output path for section dependence information (--emit_references:file)
option.tip: Aliases: --emit_references:file<BODY>When this option is set, the linker emits the following information: section size, symbols defined in the section, and references to symbols defined in the section from other sections. This information is sufficient to understand why each section has been included in the final link. The given file is used as a base name, and the format and file extension chosen by the --emit_references:format option.

option.name: Specify the format for section reference information (--emit_references:format) [TEXT]
option.tip: Aliases: --emit_references:format<BODY>When --emit_references:file is set, this option determines the format and file extension for the generated reference information file. TEXT is reasonable for manual inspection, much like the output of the --map_file option. TEXT uses a .txt extension.

option.name: Link information (map) listed into <file> (--map_file, -m)
option.tip: Aliases: --map_file, -m<BODY>Produce a listing of all input and output sections into <file>.

option.name: Specify output file name (--output_file, -o)
option.tip: Aliases: --output_file, -o<BODY>Full filename of the output file.

option.name: Heap size for C/C++ dynamic memory allocation (--heap_size, -heap)
option.tip: Aliases: --heap_size, -heap<BODY>Specify the maximum heap size for C/C++ dynamic memory allocation.

option.name: Set C system stack size (--stack_size, -stack)
option.tip: Aliases: --stack_size, -stack<BODY>Set C system stack size

option.name: Hold watchdog timer during cinit auto-initialization (--cinit_hold_wdt)
option.tip: Aliases: --cinit_hold_wdt<BODY>Hold watchdog timer during cinit portion of auto-initialization. Select off to leave watchdog enabled during cinit auto-initialization.

option.name: Include library file or command file as input (--library, -l)
option.tip: Aliases: --library, -l<BODY>Include library file or command file as input

option.name: Add <dir> to library search path (--search_path, -i)
option.tip: Aliases: --search_path, -i<BODY>Alter the library-search algorithm to look in dir before looking in the default location. This option must appear before the -l option.

option.name: End reread library group (--end-group)
option.tip: Aliases: --end-group<BODY>End reread library group

option.name: Search libraries in priority order (--priority, -priority)
option.tip: Aliases: --priority, -priority<BODY>Search libraries in priority order

option.name: Reread libraries; resolve backward references (--reread_libs, -x)
option.tip: Aliases: --reread_libs, -x<BODY>Reread libraries; resolve backward references

option.name: Begin reread library group; resolve backward references (--start-group)
option.tip: Aliases: --start-group<BODY>Begin reread library group; resolve backward references

option.name: Disable automatic RTS selection (--disable_auto_rts)
option.tip: Aliases: --disable_auto_rts<BODY>Do not attempt to automatically select and link a runtime library.

option.name: Pre-define preprocessor macro _name_ to _value_ (--define)
option.tip: Aliases: --define<BODY>Pre-define preprocessor macro _name_ to _value_

option.name: Undefine preprocessor macro _name_ (--undefine)
option.tip: Aliases: --undefine<BODY>Undefine preprocessor macro _name_

option.name: Don't use C preprocessor for command files (--disable_pp)
option.tip: Aliases: --disable_pp<BODY>This disables preprocessing of linker command files.

option.name: Line buffer diagnostic output (--buffer_diagnostics, -pdb)
option.tip: Aliases: --buffer_diagnostics, -pdb<BODY>Line buffer diagnostic output to reduce message mixing when compiling in parallel.

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as error (--diag_error)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_error<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as error

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as remark (--diag_remark)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_remark<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as remark

option.name: Suppress diagnostic <id> (--diag_suppress)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_suppress<BODY>Suppress diagnostic <id>

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as warning (--diag_warning)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_warning<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as warning

option.name: Wrap diagnostic messages (--diag_wrap)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_wrap<BODY>Set diagnostic messages to wrap at 79 columns (on) or not (off).

option.name: Emit diagnostic identifier numbers (--display_error_number)
option.tip: Aliases: --display_error_number<BODY>Emit diagnostic identifier numbers

option.name: Treat warnings as errors (--emit_warnings_as_errors, -pdew)
option.tip: Aliases: --emit_warnings_as_errors, -pdew<BODY>Treat warnings as errors

option.name: Issue remarks (--issue_remarks)
option.tip: Aliases: --issue_remarks<BODY>Issue remarks

option.name: Don't demangle symbol names in diagnostics (--no_demangle)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_demangle<BODY>Don't demangle symbol names in diagnostics

option.name: Suppress warnings (--no_warnings)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_warnings<BODY>Suppress warnings

option.name: Set error limit to <count> (--set_error_limit)
option.tip: Aliases: --set_error_limit<BODY>Set error limit to <count>

option.name: Verbose diagnostics (--verbose_diagnostics)
option.tip: Aliases: --verbose_diagnostics<BODY>Verbose diagnostics

option.name: Warn if an unspecified output section is created (--warn_sections, -w)
option.tip: Aliases: --warn_sections, -w<BODY>Warn if an unspecified output section is created

option.name: Produce absolute executable object file (default) (--absolute_exe, -a)
option.tip: Aliases: --absolute_exe, -a<BODY>Produce absolute executable object file (default)

option.name: Control whether ECC generation is on or off (--ecc)
option.tip: Aliases: --ecc<BODY>Control whether ECC generation is on or off

option.name: Introduce bit errors (--ecc:data_error)
option.tip: Aliases: --ecc:data_error<BODY>--ecc:data_error=(address|symbol+offset),[page,]bitmask - Introduce bit errors in the outfile. The bits to be flipped in the outfile are located in the unit at the specified offset. The offset is relative to either the origin of the page, or relative to the position of the base symbol, if specified. The default page is zero, and any page may be specified. The bits to be flipped at the specified location are indicated by set bits in the bitmask. In effect, the data in the outfile will be the bitwise-exclusive-or of the bitmask with original code or data. Bit errors can only be applied to initialized data, such as the contents of Flash memory. The effective address of the error must lie inside either the output memory range or the input memory range of an ECC specification.

option.name: Introduce bit errors in ECC memory (--ecc:ecc_error)
option.tip: Aliases: --ecc:ecc_error<BODY>--ecc:ecc_error=(address|symbol+offset),[page,]bitmask - Introduce bit errors in corresponding ECC memory. This option behaves like the --ecc:data_error option, except that the bits are not flipped in the code/data memory at the specified location. Instead, the bits are flipped in the ECC memory area that corresponds to the specified location. The bitmask is 8 bits wide. In the presence of mirroring, bits will be flipped in all mirrored copies of the corresponding ECC byte. The effective address of the error must lie inside the input memory range of an ECC specification.

option.name: List removed dead functions into file (--generate_dead_funcs_list)
option.tip: Aliases: --generate_dead_funcs_list<BODY>Create a list, into the file <fname>, of the routines and sections that are dead (never referenced) and were removed by the linker. The default <fname> is 'dead_funcs.txt'.

option.name: Display attribute settings in map file (--mapfile_contents)
option.tip: Aliases: --mapfile_contents<BODY>Enable the display of <attribute> or disable with no<attribute> in the linker generated map file. Multiple attributes can be specified by separating them with commas (e.g. --mapfile_contents=sections,nosymbols). Type --mapfile_contents=help for a list of attributes.

option.name: Produce a relocatable output module (--relocatable, -r)
option.tip: Aliases: --relocatable, -r<BODY>Produce a relocatable output module

option.name: Detailed link information data-base into <file> (--xml_link_info, -xml_link_info)
option.tip: Aliases: --xml_link_info, -xml_link_info<BODY>Produce a detailed link information data-base into the file named <file>.

option.name: Specify program entry point for the output module (--entry_point, -e)
option.tip: Aliases: --entry_point, -e<BODY>Specify program entry point for the output module

option.name: Do not localize symbols matching pattern (--globalize)
option.tip: Aliases: --globalize<BODY>The option '--localize=l_pattern' makes the symbols matching the l_pattern hidden. The '--globalilze=g_pattern' option excludes symbols matching g_pattern from symbol localization provided g_pattern is more restrictive than l_pattern.

option.name: Hide symbols matching pattern (--hide)
option.tip: Aliases: --hide<BODY>Hide the symbols matching the pattern by changing the name to empty string

option.name: Make the symbols matching pattern local (--localize)
option.tip: Aliases: --localize<BODY>Given a symbol name pattern, make all the symbols matching this pattern local

option.name: Don't make global symbol static if -h is specified (--make_global, -g)
option.tip: Aliases: --make_global, -g<BODY>Don't make global symbol static if -h is specified

option.name: Make all global symbols static (--make_static, -h)
option.tip: Aliases: --make_static, -h<BODY>Make all global symbols static

option.name: No type merging in symbolic debugging information (--no_sym_merge, -b)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_sym_merge, -b<BODY>Disable type merging in symbolic debugging information.

option.name: Strip symbol table and line number entries (--no_symtable, -s)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_symtable, -s<BODY>Strip symbol table and line number entries

option.name: Specify symbols/sections to be retained by linker (--retain)
option.tip:
Aliases: --retain<BODY>When --unused_section_elimination is enabled, the ELF linker does not include a section in the final link if it is not needed in the executable to resolve references. This option can be used to tell the linker to retain a list of sections that would otherwise be not retained. This option accepts the wild cards '*' and '?' and when wild cards are used, the argument should be in quotes. The following option parameters are accepted:
--retain=symbol_spec retains sections that define symbol matching the argument. For ex, --retain='init*' retains sections that define symbols that start with 'init'. User may not specify --retain='*'.
--retain=file_spec(scn_spec [,scn_spec ...]) retains sections matching scn_spec(s) from files matching file_spec. For ex, the argument '*(.initvec)' causes the linker to retain .initvec sections from all input files.
NOTE: User can specify --retain='*(*)' to retain all the sections from all the input object files. Note that this does not prevent sections from library members from being optimized out. If you want to totally disable unused section elimination, please use --unused_section_elimination=off.
--retain=ar_spec<mem_spec, [mem_spec ...]>(scn_spec, [scn_spec ...]) retains sections matching scn_spec(s) from members matching mem_spec(s) from archive files matching ar_spec. For ex, rts32eabi.lib<printf.obj>(.text) causes the linker to retain .text section from printf.obj in rts32eabi.lib. If the library is specified with -l option (-lrts32eabi.lib) the library search path is used to search the library. User may not specify '*<*>(*)'.

option.name: Scan libraries for duplicate symbol definitions (--scan_libraries, -scanlibs)
option.tip: Aliases: --scan_libraries, -scanlibs<BODY>Check whether symbol definitions that are pulled into the link are duplicated in any of the libraries included in the build. This information is typically ignored as the linker will pull in the first definition it encounters.

option.name: Specify a symbol map, mapping refname to defname (--symbol_map)
option.tip: Aliases: --symbol_map<BODY>Symbol mapping allows a symbol reference to be resolved by a symbol with different name. Symbol mapping allows functions to be overridden with alternate definitions. This feature can be used to patch in alternate implementations, which provide patches (bug fixes) or alternate functionality. For example, the option --symbol_map='foo=foo_patch' makes the linker resolve any references to foo by the definition foo_patch.

option.name: Add <sym> to symbol table as an unresolved symbol (--undef_sym, -u)
option.tip: Aliases: --undef_sym, -u<BODY>Add <sym> to symbol table as an unresolved symbol

option.name: Exclude symbols matching pattern from hiding (--unhide)
option.tip: Aliases: --unhide<BODY>The option --hide=hide_pattern makes the symbols matching the hide_pattern hidden. The --unhide=unhide_pattern option excludes symbols matching unhide_pattern from symbol hiding provided unhide_pattern is more restrictive than hide_pattern.

option.name: Set C argc/argv memory size (--arg_size, --args)
option.tip: Aliases: --arg_size, --args<BODY>Set C argc/argv memory size

option.name: Compress ELF C style auto initialization data (--cinit_compression)
option.tip: Aliases: --cinit_compression<BODY>Specify the compression to apply to the c auto initialization data

option.name: Compress ELF sections copied using copy tables (--copy_compression)
option.tip: Aliases: --copy_compression<BODY>Overlays can be managed by using linker generated copy tables. To save ROM space, the linker can compress the data copied by copy tables. The compressed data is decompressed during copy.

option.name: Default fill value for holes in output sections (--fill_value, -f)
option.tip: Aliases: --fill_value, -f<BODY>Set the default fill value for filling holes in output sections.

option.name: Input existing CMSE import library to be updated (--import_cmse_lib_in)
option.tip: Aliases: --import_cmse_lib_in<BODY>Input existing CMSE import library to be updated

option.name: Create a CMSE output library file (--import_cmse_lib_out)
option.tip: Aliases: --import_cmse_lib_out<BODY>Create a CMSE output library file

option.name: Generate far call trampolines (--trampolines)
option.tip: Aliases: --trampolines<BODY>Generate far call trampolines

option.name: Initialization model
option.tip: Initialization model<BODY><ITEM>(--rom_model, -c) - Link using ROM autoinitialization model<ITEM>(--ram_model, -cr) - Link using RAM autoinitialization model

option.name: Aggressively reduce size of the DWARF information (--compress_dwarf)
option.tip: Aliases: --compress_dwarf<BODY>Aggressively reduce the size of the DWARF information. When this option used, the DWARF information is parsed and examined to look for and eliminate duplicate types, and builds a .debug_abbrev table for the whole program.

option.name: Disable conditional linking and ignore .clink (--disable_clink, -j)
option.tip: Aliases: --disable_clink, -j<BODY>Disable conditional linking; ignore all .clink directives.

option.name: Select trampoline minimization algorithm (--minimize_trampolines)
option.tip: Aliases: --minimize_trampolines<BODY>This option attempts to place sections so as to minimize the number of far call trampolines required, possibly at the expense of optimal memory packing. The argument selects a heuristic to use. The 'postorder' heuristic attempts to place functions before their callers so that the PC-relative offset is known when the caller is placed.

option.name: Add <function> to preferred placement order list (--preferred_order)
option.tip: Aliases: --preferred_order<BODY>Insert a function into the preferred function order list for placement. Functions that are close to each other in the preferred function order list will tend to be placed close together (increase program locality between them). Static functions of the same name can be distinguished from each other by prefixing the function name with the path and file in which the function is defined followed by a ':' character to delimit the beginning of the function name.

option.name: Strict compatibility checking (--strict_compatibility)
option.tip: Aliases: --strict_compatibility<BODY>Strict compatibility checking

option.name: Minimum space between non-adjacent trampolines (--trampoline_min_spacing)
option.tip: Aliases: --trampoline_min_spacing<BODY>When trampoline reservations are spaced more closely than this limit, try to make them adjacent. A higher value minimizes fragmentation, but may result in more trampolines. A lower value may reduce trampolines, at the expense of fragmentation and linker running time. Specifying 0 for this option disables coalescing. The default is 16K.

option.name: Eliminate sections not needed in the executable (--unused_section_elimination)
option.tip: Aliases: --unused_section_elimination<BODY>In order to minimize memory use, the linker does not include a section that is not needed to resolve any references in the final executable. --unused_section_elimination=off can be used to disable this optimization.

option.name: Zero initialize ELF uninitialized sections (--zero_init)
option.tip: Aliases: --zero_init<BODY>This option indicates that the linker should generate compressed cinit table records that zero initializes ELF uninitialized sections during boot. This option is ignored if --rom_model option is not specified.

option.name: Optimization level (--cg_opt_level)
option.tip: Aliases: --cg_opt_level<BODY>Set compiler optimization level. This flag corresponds to the -O flag that would be passed to tiarmclang.

option.name: Choose between fast and slow version of memcpy (--use_memcpy)
option.tip: Aliases: --use_memcpy<BODY>Override the decision made by --cg_opt_level regarding whether to optimize memcpy for speed or code size.

option.name: Choose between fast and slow version of memset (--use_memset)
option.tip: Aliases: --use_memset<BODY>Override the decision made by --cg_opt_level regarding whether to optimize memset for speed or code size.

option.name: Output as bytes rather than target addressing (--byte, -byte)
option.tip: Aliases: --byte, -byte<BODY>Output as bytes rather than target addressing.

option.name: Specify CMAC key file name and enable CMAC (--cmac=file)
option.tip: Aliases: --cmac=file<BODY>Specify CMAC key file name and enable CMAC.

option.name: Specify entrypoint address or symbol name (--entrypoint, -e=addr)
option.tip: Aliases: --entrypoint, -e=addr<BODY>Specify entrypoint address or symbol name.

option.name: Exclude section from hex conversion (--exclude, -exclude=section)
option.tip: Aliases: --exclude, -exclude=section<BODY>Exclude section from hex conversion.

option.name: Specify fill value (--fill, -fill=val)
option.tip: Aliases: --fill, -fill=val<BODY>Specify fill value.

option.name: Select image mode (--image, -image)
option.tip: Aliases: --image, -image<BODY>Select image mode.

option.name: Include linker fill sections in images (--linkerfill, -linkerfill)
option.tip: Aliases: --linkerfill, -linkerfill<BODY>Include linker fill sections in images.

option.name: Specify map file name (--map, -map=file)
option.tip: Aliases: --map, -map=file<BODY>Specify map file name.

option.name: Specify memory width (--memwidth, -memwidth=width)
option.tip: Aliases: --memwidth, -memwidth=width<BODY>Specify memory width.

option.name: Specify output file names (--outfile, -o=file)
option.tip: Aliases: --outfile, -o=file<BODY>Specify output file names.

option.name: Quiet Operation (--quiet, -quiet, -q)
option.tip: Aliases: --quiet, -quiet, -q<BODY>Quiet Operation.

option.name: Specify rom width (--romwidth, -romwidth=width)
option.tip: Aliases: --romwidth, -romwidth=width<BODY>Specify rom width.

option.name: Zero based addressing (--zero, -zero, -z)
option.tip: Aliases: --zero, -zero, -z<BODY>Zero based addressing.

option.name: Line buffer diagnostic output (--buffer_diagnostics, -pdb)
option.tip: Aliases: --buffer_diagnostics, -pdb<BODY>Line buffer diagnostic output.

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as error (--diag_error=id)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_error=id<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as error.

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as remark (--diag_remark=id)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_remark=id<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as remark.

option.name: Suppress diagnostic <id> (--diag_suppress=id)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_suppress=id<BODY>Suppress diagnostic <id>.

option.name: Treat diagnostic <id> as warning (--diag_warning=id)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_warning=id<BODY>Treat diagnostic <id> as warning.

option.name: Wrap diagnostic messages (--diag_wrap)
option.tip: Aliases: --diag_wrap<BODY>Wrap diagnostic messages.

option.name: Emit diagnostic identifier numbers (--display_error_number)
option.tip: Aliases: --display_error_number<BODY>Emit diagnostic identifier numbers.

option.name: Treat warnings as errors (--emit_warnings_as_errors, -pdew)
option.tip: Aliases: --emit_warnings_as_errors, -pdew<BODY>Treat warnings as errors.

option.name: Issue remarks (--issue_remarks)
option.tip: Aliases: --issue_remarks<BODY>Issue remarks.

option.name: Suppress warnings (--no_warnings)
option.tip: Aliases: --no_warnings<BODY>Suppress warnings.

option.name: Set error limit to <count> (--set_error_limit=count)
option.tip: Aliases: --set_error_limit=count<BODY>Set error limit to <count>.

option.name: Select boot mode (--boot, -boot)
option.tip: Aliases: --boot, -boot<BODY>Select boot mode.

option.name: Specify origin address or symbol of boot table ROM (--bootorg, -bootorg=addr)
option.tip: Aliases: --bootorg, -bootorg=addr<BODY>Specify origin address or symbol of boot table ROM.

option.name: Specify table source as the GPIO port, 16-bit mode (--gpio16, -gpio16)
option.tip: Aliases: --gpio16, -gpio16<BODY>Specify table source as the GPIO port, 16-bit mode.

option.name: Specify table source as the GPIO port, 8-bit mode (--gpio8, -gpio8)
option.tip: Aliases: --gpio8, -gpio8<BODY>Specify table source as the GPIO port, 8-bit mode.

option.name: Specify table source as the I2C8 port, 8-bit mode (--i2c8, -i2c8)
option.tip: Aliases: --i2c8, -i2c8<BODY>Specify table source as the I2C8 port, 8-bit mode.

option.name: Specify the initial value for I2CCLKH register (--i2cclkh, -i2cclkh=value)
option.tip: Aliases: --i2cclkh, -i2cclkh=value<BODY>Specify the initial value for I2CCLKH register.

option.name: Specify the initial value for the I2CCLKL register (--i2cclkl, -i2cclkl=value)
option.tip: Aliases: --i2cclkl, -i2cclkl=value<BODY>Specify the initial value for the I2CCLKL register.

option.name: Specify the initial value for I2CPSC register (--i2cpsc, -i2cpsc=value)
option.tip: Aliases: --i2cpsc, -i2cpsc=value<BODY>Specify the initial value for I2CPSC register.

option.name: Specify the initial value for the LOSPCP register (--lospcp, -lospcp=value)
option.tip: Aliases: --lospcp, -lospcp=value<BODY>Specify the initial value for the LOSPCP register.

option.name: Specify table source as the SPI port, 8-bit mode (--spi8, -spi8)
option.tip: Aliases: --spi8, -spi8<BODY>Specify table source as the SPI port, 8-bit mode.

option.name: Specify the initial value for the SPIBRR register (--spibrr, -spibrr=value)
option.tip: Aliases: --spibrr, -spibrr=value<BODY>Specify the initial value for the SPIBRR register.

option.name: Output format
option.tip: <BODY>Output format.

option.name: Array (--array)
option.tip: Aliases: --array<BODY>Array.

option.name: Binary (for DSKs) (--binary, -b)
option.tip: Aliases: --binary, -b<BODY>Binary (for DSKs).

option.name: Object format
option.tip: <BODY>Object format.

option.name: Select the endianness of the host (--host_image:endianness)
option.tip: Aliases: --host_image:endianness<BODY>Select the endianness of the host.

option.name: Determine the visibility of symbols (--host_image:hidden_symbols)
option.tip: Aliases: --host_image:hidden_symbols<BODY>Determine the visibility of symbols.

option.name: Explicitly make a host image symbol hidden (--host_image:hide=string)
option.tip: Aliases: --host_image:hide=string<BODY>Explicitly make a host image symbol hidden.

option.name: Explicitly make a host image symbol visible (--host_image:show=string)
option.tip: Aliases: --host_image:show=string<BODY>Explicitly make a host image symbol visible.

option.name: Machine type of the host image (--host_image:target)
option.tip: Aliases: --host_image:target<BODY>Machine type of the host image.

option.name: Specify whether sections should be combined or (--load_image:combine_sections)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:combine_sections<BODY>Specify whether sections should be combined or.

option.name: Specify the object file endianness (--load_image:endian)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:endian<BODY>Specify the object file endianness.

option.name: Specify the output file type (--load_image:file_type)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:file_type<BODY>Specify the output file type.

option.name: Specify the object file format (--load_image:format)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:format<BODY>Specify the object file format.

option.name: Do not localize the symbol (--load_image:globalize=string)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:globalize=string<BODY>Do not localize the symbol.

option.name: Make the symbol local (--load_image:localize=string)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:localize=string<BODY>Make the symbol local.

option.name: Specify the object file machine name (--load_image:machine)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:machine<BODY>Specify the object file machine name.

option.name: Specify if symbols should be output to the file. (--load_image:output_symbols)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:output_symbols<BODY>Specify if symbols should be output to the file..

option.name: Specify if the section address field should be (--load_image:section_addresses)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:section_addresses<BODY>Specify if the section address field should be.

option.name: Specify the prefix for the section names (--load_image:section_prefix=string)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:section_prefix=string<BODY>Specify the prefix for the section names.

option.name: Default binding of symbols in the load image (--load_image:symbol_binding)
option.tip: Aliases: --load_image:symbol_binding<BODY>Default binding of symbols in the load image.

option.name: Prefix for load/host image object sections (--section_name_prefix=string)
option.tip: Aliases: --section_name_prefix=string<BODY>Prefix for load/host image object sections.

option.name: Prefix for output array names (--array:name_prefix=string)
option.tip: Aliases: --array:name_prefix=string<BODY>Prefix for output array names.

extension.name: TMS470 vTICLANG_2.0 Build-option Migration Rule Index

diagnostic.message: tiarmclang's -O3 option enables aggressive performance optimizations that may impact code size and compile time; you might consider using -Ofast instead, but be aware that -Ofast employs some optimizations that may not strictly conform to the IEEE floating-point standard

tiarmclang's -O3 option enables aggressive performance optimizations that may impact code size and compile time; you might consider using -Ofast instead, but be aware that -Ofast employs some optimizations that may not strictly conform to the IEEE floating-point standard

tiarmclang's -O3 option enables aggressive performance optimizations that may impact code size and compile time; you might consider using -Ofast instead, but be aware that -Ofast employs some optimizations that may not strictly conform to the IEEE floating-point standard

tiarmclang does not support big-endian mode on Cortex-M architectures; armcl's --endian-big option will be mapped to -mlittle-endian
tiarmclang does not support big-endian mode on Cortex-M architectures; armcl's --endian-big option will be mapped to -mlittle-endian
tiarmclang does not support big-endian mode on Cortex-M architectures; armcl's --endian-big option will be mapped to -mlittle-endian
tiarmclang does not support ARM mode instructions on Cortex-M architectures; armcl's --code_state=32 option will be mapped to -mthumb
tiarmclang does not support ARM mode instructions on Cortex-M architectures; armcl's --code_state=32 option will be mapped to -mthumb
tiarmclang does not support ARM mode instructions on Cortex-M architectures; armcl's --code_state=32 option will be mapped to -mthumb
tiarmclang's -O2 option enables moderately aggressive performance optimizations while limiting compile time impact, but may impact code size
tiarmclang's -O2 option enables moderately aggressive performance optimizations while limiting compile time impact, but may impact code size
tiarmclang's -O3 option enables aggressive performance optimizations that may impact code size and compile time

tiarmclang's -O3 option enables aggressive performance optimizations that may impact code size and compile time; tiarmclang does not support whole-program optimizations that are available with armcl's --opt_level=4

tiarmclang's -O3 option enables aggressive performance optimizations that may impact code size and compile time; tiarmclang does not support whole-program optimizations that are available with armcl's --opt_level=4
tiarmclang's -Os option enables moderately aggressive performance optimizations combined with additional code size optimizations

tiarmclang's -Oz option enables moderately aggressive performance optimizations combined with aggressive code size optimizations that may affect performance
tiarmclang's -Oz option enables moderately aggressive performance optimizations combined with aggressive code size optimizations that may affect performance
tiarmclang's -Oz option enables moderately aggressive performance optimizations combined with aggressive code size optimizations that may affect performance

unaligned accesses are not supported on the Cortex-M0 processor; armcl's --unaligned_access=on will be mapped to tiarmclang's -mno-unaligned-access
tiarmclang only supports fpv4-sp-d16 FPU in combination with Cortex-M4 processor
tiarmclang only supports fpv4-sp-d16 FPU in combination with Cortex-M4 processor
tiarmclang only supports fpv4-sp-d16 FPU in combination with Cortex-M4 processor
tiarmclang only supports fpv4-sp-d16 FPU in combination with Cortex-M4 processor
tiarmclang only supports vfpv3-d16 FPU in combination with Cortex-R4 or Cortex-R5 processor
tiarmclang only supports vfpv3-d16 FPU in combination with Cortex-R4 or Cortex-R5 processor

specified --entry_parm option ignored; the use of armcl's --entry_hook option will be replacd by tiarmclang's -finstrument-functions option, which generates calls to __cyg_profile_function_entry() and __cyg_profile_function_exit(); these functions are called with the address of the current function and the call site address

specified --exit_parm option ignored; the use of armcl's --exit_hook option will be replacd by tiarmclang's -finstrument-functions option, which generates calls to __cyg_profile_function_entry() and __cyg_profile_function_exit(); these functions are called with the address of the current function and the call site address
tiarmclang's -O0 option disables optimization
tiarmclang's -O1 option enables basic performance optimizations
ALL temp files will be kept drom compilation
tiarmclang does not generate DWARF v4 debug information
tiarmclang does not support 16-bit wchar_t in its runtime libraries; the --wchar_t=16 option will map to tiarmclang's -fno-short-wchar option (32-bit wchar_t type assumed)
C++ exception handling is not supported in the current tiarmclang compiler toolchain; --exceptions option ignored

armcl --entry_hook/--exit_hook options replaced by tiarmclang -finstrument_functions option that will generate calls to __cyg_profile_func_enter() and __cyg_profile_func_exit(); definitions of these functions must be supplied by the user

armcl --entry_hook/--exit_hook options replaced by tiarmclang -finstrument_functions option that will generate calls to __cyg_profile_func_enter() and __cyg_profile_func_exit(); definitions of these functions must be supplied by the user
tiarmclang does not support specified processor (-mv4, -mv5e, -mv6, -mv7A8); tiarmclang does support cortex-m0, cortex-m3, cortex-m4, cortex-r4, cortex-r5, cortex-m33
tiarmclang does not support specified processor (-mv4, -mv5e, -mv6, -mv7A8); tiarmclang does support cortex-m0, cortex-m3, cortex-m4, cortex-r4, cortex-r5, cortex-m33
tiarmclang does not support specified processor (-mv4, -mv5e, -mv6, -mv7A8); tiarmclang does support cortex-m0, cortex-m3, cortex-m4, cortex-r4, cortex-r5, cortex-m33
tiarmclang does not support specified processor (-mv4, -mv5e, -mv6, -mv7A8); tiarmclang does support cortex-m0, cortex-m3, cortex-m4, cortex-r4, cortex-r5, cortex-m33
tiarmclang does not support specified floating-point hardware (VFPv2, VFPv3)
tiarmclang does not support specified floating-point hardware (VFPv2, VFPv3)
tiarmclang only suppoprts EABI
tiarmclang does not support whole program mode compilation; option ignored
tiarmclang does not support whole program mode compilation; option ignored
tiarmclang does not support an option that is functionally equivalent to armcl's --call_assumptions; option ignored
tiarmclang does not support an option that is functionally equivalent to armcl's --auto_inline; option ignored
tiarmclang does not support an option that is functionally equivalent to armcl's --disable_inlining; option ignored
tiarmclang does not support a functionally equivalent option for armcl's --sydebug:skeletal
armcl's --fp_mode=relaxed option ignored; --fp_mode=relaxed does not map directly to a tiarmclang option, however, tiarmclang's -ffast-math is its closest functionally equivalent option
tiarmclang does not limit the precision of floating point operations; tiarmclang will accept 32- and 64-bit floating point precision operations
tiarmclang does not limit the precision of floating point operations; tiarmclang will accept 32- and 64-bit floating point precision operations
tiarmclang does not limit the precision of floating point operations; tiarmclang will accept 32- and 64-bit floating point precision operations
tiarmclang does not support checking of ULP power rules; --advice:power option will not be migrated
tiarmclang does not support checking of ULP power rules; --advice:power_severity option will not be migrated
C++ exception handling is not supported in the current tiarmclang compiler toolchain; --extern_c_can_throw option ignored
tiarmclang does not support checking of MISRA-C:2004 rules; --check_misra option will not be migrated
tiarmclang does not support checking of MISRA-C:2004 rules; --misra_advisory and/or --misra_required options will not be migrated
tiarmclang does not support checking of MISRA-C:2004 rules; --misra_advisory and/or --misra_required options will not be migrated
tiarmclang does not support armcl's --gen_preprocessor_listing functionality; option will not be migrated
tiarmclang does not support armcl's --gen_cross_reference_listing functionality; option will not be migrated
tiarmclang does not support armcl's --gen_func_info_listing functionality; option will not be migrated
tiarmclang does not support emitting section size summary information; --section_size option will not be migrated
tiarmclang does not support armcl's --parallel functionality; option will not be migrated
tiarmclang only supports ELF object format with DWARF debug information
tiarmclang only supports ELF object format with DWARF debug information
use of legacy TI pragmas will be flagged as errors
use of legacy TI pre-defined macro symbols will be flagged as errors
use of legacy TI intrinsics will be flagged as errors

deprecate.diagnostic: the --language option is deprecated in favor of the functionally equivalent -x option
The --generate_dead_funcs_list option is no longer supported.
--array has been moved into the 'Output format' drop-down list - please make your selection there.
--binary has been moved into the 'Output format' drop-down list - please make your selection there.
--host_image is deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent release.
--host_image:endianness is deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent release.
--host_image:hidden_symbols is deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent release.
--host_image:hide is deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent release.
--host_image:show is deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent release.
--host_image:target is deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent release.
--section_name_prefix is deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent release.
